alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:24PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Weld and northwestern Adams Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 424 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Barr Lake, or 16 miles northeast of Denver, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Thornton, Commerce City, Brighton, Firestone, northwestern Denver International Airport, Frederick, Fort Lupton, Lochbuie, Platteville, Hudson, Milton Reservoir, Barr Lake and Todd Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
